page.title: 09CONSTANTINE FARMING 1
page.content: TYPES OF FARMING;many of the farms in the area are small in comparision to those in other parts of the country. Herds of milking cows,notably Fresians are common,since they bring in a steady income.Mixed crops are grown especially potatoes,broccoli and cabbages.Most farms have fertilised grass land used for making silage for Winter cattle food.Some farmers also keep pigs which are fed on surplus milk.Battery hens and calves are found on some farms. HORTICULTURE.There are a number of small holdings and allotments n the area which supply vegetables and flowers to the village and local markets.Early strawberries are grown in fields near Trengilly Wartha.There is a garden centre at Highcross which supplies many types of plants especially Azelias,which grow well.
